definition: huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Hu
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
erhua variant of 胡琴[hu2 qin2]

sentences.english: When the teacher saw the time, the heart will not have any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 當老師看到胡琴的時候，心中就不會再有什麼遺憾了。

sentences.english: However, I was in the very next day will the hurried back to him.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我卻在第二天就將胡琴趕緊還給了他。

sentences.english: Due to the stage performance, he made an exception to the lent me.
sentences.chinese: 因爲要登臺演奏，他才破例將胡琴借給了我。

definition: jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
erhu (Chinese 2-string fiddle)/alto fiddle/CL:把[ba3]
a bowed stringed instrument with a thin wooden soundboard
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
sihu (or "khuurchir" in Mongolian), a bowed instrument with four strings, primarily associated with Mongolian and Chinese culture
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
yangqin/dulcimer (hammered string musical instrument)
bamboo flute/CL:管[guan3]
same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
clapper-board
variant of 揚琴|扬琴[yang2 qin2]
two-stringed bowed instrument/also called 墜琴|坠琴[zhui4 qin2]
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
yueqin, a lute with oval or octagonal sound box
small drum for marking time
